titleStmt.title: Englands old religion faithfully gathered out of the history of the Church of England, as it was written by Venerable Bede, almost a thousand years agoe (that is) in the year 698 after the passion of our Saviour : Bede saith he ended this history in the year 731 after the incarnation : we have not altered any part of this Fathers own words in any point concerning faith : only here and there is omitted what belongeth not to that purpose / by H.B.
Historia ecclesiastica gentis Anglorum. English. Selections
titleStmt.author: Bede, the Venerable, Saint, 673-735.
Beaumont, Henry, 1611 or 12-1673.

notesStmt.note: H.B. is Henry Harcourt, alias Beaumont, S.J. Cf. BM.
Translation of: Historia ecclesiastica gentis Anglorum.
Imperfect: copy on reel 741:9 lacking 3 p. at end.
Reproduction of original in British Library and Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
Entry for H694 cancelled in Wing (2nd ed.).
